Fields.Name: StudyArmName
Fields.Summary: Name of the Arm - INVARIANT! because it is used to generate Identifers for induced executions!

Fields.Name: RootProcedureScheduleId
Fields.Summary: the ProcedureSchedule which is representing the primary-/entry-workflow (estimated visits) for participants of this arm

Fields.Name: AllowedSubstudies
Fields.Summary: comma sparated list of Sub-Study names which are allowed to be executed for this arm

Fields.Name: StudyWorkflowName
Fields.Summary: the official invariant name of the study as given by the sponsor

Fields.Name: StudyWorkflowVersion
Fields.Summary: This value follows the rules of 'Semantic Versioning' (https://semver.org) and needs to be updated exactly and only on transition to DraftState.Released! If the previously DraftState was 'DraftNewFix', then the 3. number must be increased at this time! If the previously DraftState was 'DraftNewMinor', then the 2. number must be increased, and the 3. number must be set to 0 at this time! If the previously DraftState was 'DraftNewMajor', then the 1. number must be increased, and the 2.+3. number must be set to 0 at this time!

Fields.Name: LogoImage
Fields.Summary: Logo in base64

Fields.Name: VersionIdentity
Fields.Summary: IT MUST NOT be updated on every change during Draft! Format: the Author, which is starting the new Draft (Alphanumeric, in PascalCase without blanks or other Symbols) + the current UTC-Time when setting the value (in ISO8601 format) separated by a Pipe "|" Sample: "MaxMustermann|2020-06-15T13:45:30.0000000Z".

Fields.Name: DraftState
Fields.Summary: 0=Released / 1=DraftNewFix / 2=DraftNewMinor / 3=DraftNewMajor

Fields.Name: ScheduleWorkflowName
Fields.Summary: Name of the Workflow which is represented by this schedule - INVARIANT! because it is used to generate Identifers for induced executions!

Fields.Name: TaskDefinitionName
Fields.Summary: Name of the Definition - INVARIANT! because it is used to generate Identifers for induced executions!

Fields.Name: DataSchemaUrl
Fields.Summary: schema-url of the data which have to be recorded

Fields.Name: DefaultData
Fields.Summary: RAW data, in the schema as defined at the 'DataSchemaUrl'

Fields.Name: SchedulingOffset
Fields.Summary: estimated scheduling time relative to the scheduling date of the parent TaskSchedule

Fields.Name: SchedulingOffsetUnit
Fields.Summary: 'h'=Hours / 'm'=Minutes / 's'=Seconds

Fields.Name: SchedulingVariabilityBefore
Fields.Summary: defines an additional variability RELATIVE to the estimated scheduling time (which is calculated from the offset), in this case the EARLIEST possible time.

Fields.Name: SchedulingVariabilityAfter
Fields.Summary: defines an additional variability RELATIVE to the estimated scheduling time (which is calculated from the offset), in this case the LATEST possible time.

Fields.Name: SchedulingVariabilityUnit
Fields.Summary: 'h'=Hours / 'm'=Minutes / 's'=Seconds

Fields.Name: UniqueExecutionName
Fields.Summary: the name for the induced execution, like 'Measurement X', which is usually defined by the study protocol. if multiple inducements are possible (for example when using cycles), the title should to contain a placeholder (example: '{vt} - Measurement X') to prevent from duplicate execution names.

Fields.Name: Skipable
Fields.Summary: defines, if the study protocol tolerates this execution to be 'skipped' (if not, a missed execution is treated as 'lost' and can cause the exclusion of the participant)

Fields.Name: Position
Fields.Summary: The Position (1..x) of this inducement within the parent schedule. This value is relevant for addressing predecessors as fixpoint for the offest-calculation. Within one schedule there can only be one inducement for each position! The 0 is reserved for addressing the parent schedule itself and must not be used as well as negative values!

Fields.Name: SchedulingOffsetFixpoint
Fields.Summary:
0=InducementOfScheduleOrCycle: when the start of the parent Schedule (for the current cycle) was induced / -1=InducementOfPredessessor: when the direct predecessor task or subschedule (based on the 'Position') within the current schedule was induced / 1..x: when the predecessor at the Position within the current schedule, ADRESSED by the given value, was induced 
*items of sub-schedules are not relevant - when addressing a sub-schedule as predecessor, then only its entry will be used
*this behaviour can be concretized via 'SchedulingByEstimate'

Fields.Name: SchedulingByEstimate
Fields.Summary: If set to true, the offset calculation will be based on the ESTIMATED completion of the predecessor (see 'Fixpoint'). Otherwise, when set to false, the offset calculation will be based on the REAL completion (if recorded execution data is available during calculation) of the predecessor. *this will not evaluated, when the 'Fixpoint' is set to 0!

Fields.Name: DedicatedToSubstudy
Fields.Summary: The name of a Sub-Study for which this Task should be induced or empty when its part of the current Arms regular workflow

Fields.Name: TaskNumber
Fields.Summary: Number, which can be used via Placeholder {#} within the UniqueExecutionName and which will automatically increase when using cycles or sub-schedules

Fields.Name: TaskDefinitionName
Fields.Summary: Name of the Definition - INVARIANT! because it is used to generate Identifers for induced executions!

Fields.Name: SchedulingOffset
Fields.Summary: estimated scheduling time relative to the scheduling date of the parent TaskSchedule

Fields.Name: SchedulingOffsetUnit
Fields.Summary: 'h'=Hours / 'm'=Minutes / 's'=Seconds

Fields.Name: SchedulingVariabilityBefore
Fields.Summary: defines an additional variability RELATIVE to the estimated scheduling time (which is calculated from the offset), in this case the EARLIEST possible time.

Fields.Name: SchedulingVariabilityAfter
Fields.Summary: defines an additional variability RELATIVE to the estimated scheduling time (which is calculated from the offset), in this case the LATEST possible time.

Fields.Name: SchedulingVariabilityUnit
Fields.Summary: 'h'=Hours / 'm'=Minutes / 's'=Seconds

Fields.Name: UniqueExecutionName
Fields.Summary: the name for the induced execution, like 'Measurement X', which is usually defined by the study protocol. if multiple inducements are possible (for example when using cycles), the title should to contain a placeholder (example: '{vt} - Measurement X') to prevent from duplicate execution names.

Fields.Name: Skipable
Fields.Summary: defines, if the study protocol tolerates this execution to be 'skipped' (if not, a missed execution is treated as 'lost' and can cause the exclusion of the participant)

Fields.Name: Position
Fields.Summary: The Position (1..x) of this inducement within the parent schedule. This value is relevant for addressing predecessors as fixpoint for the offest-calculation. Within one schedule there can only be one inducement for each position! The 0 is reserved for addressing the parent schedule itself and must not be used as well as negative values!

Fields.Name: SchedulingOffsetFixpoint
Fields.Summary:
0=InducementOfScheduleOrCycle: when the start of the parent Schedule (for the current cycle) was induced / -1=InducementOfPredessessor: when the direct predecessor task or subschedule (based on the 'Position') within the current schedule was induced / 1..x: when the predecessor at the Position within the current schedule, ADRESSED by the given value, was induced 
*items of sub-schedules are not relevant - when addressing a sub-schedule as predecessor, then only its entry will be used
*this behaviour can be concretized via 'SchedulingByEstimate'

Fields.Name: SchedulingByEstimate
Fields.Summary: If set to true, the offset calculation will be based on the ESTIMATED completion of the predecessor (see 'Fixpoint'). Otherwise, when set to false, the offset calculation will be based on the REAL completion (if recorded execution data is available during calculation) of the predecessor. *this will not evaluated, when the 'Fixpoint' is set to 0!

Fields.Name: DedicatedToSubstudy
Fields.Summary: The name of a Sub-Study for which this Task should be induced or empty when its part of the current Arms regular workflow

Fields.Name: TaskNumber
Fields.Summary: Number, which can be used via Placeholder {#} within the UniqueExecutionName and which will automatically increase when using cycles or sub-schedules

Fields.Name: ScheduleWorkflowName
Fields.Summary: Name of the Workflow which is represented by this schedule - INVARIANT! because it is used to generate Identifers for induced executions!

Fields.Name: SchedulingOffset
Fields.Summary: estimated scheduling date relative to the scheduling date of the parent ProcedureSchedule

Fields.Name: SchedulingOffsetUnit
Fields.Summary: 'M'=Months / 'W'=Weeks / 'D'=Days

Fields.Name: SchedulingVariabilityBefore
Fields.Summary: defines an additional variability RELATIVE to the estimated scheduling date (which is calculated from the offset), in this case the EARLIEST possible date.

Fields.Name: SchedulingVariabilityAfter
Fields.Summary: defines an additional variability RELATIVE to the estimated scheduling date (which is calculated from the offset), in this case the LATEST possible date.

Fields.Name: SchedulingVariabilityUnit
Fields.Summary: 'M'=Months / 'W'=Weeks / 'D'=Days

Fields.Name: UniqueExecutionName
Fields.Summary: the name for the induced execution (=VISIT), like 'V0', which is usually defined by the study protocol. if multiple inducements are possible (for example when using cycles), the title should to contain a placeholder (example: 'C{cy}-V0') to prevent from duplicate execution names.

Fields.Name: Skipable
Fields.Summary: defines, if the study protocol tolerates this execution to be 'skipped' (if not, a missed execution is treated as 'lost' and can cause the exclusion of the participant)

Fields.Name: Position
Fields.Summary: The Position (1..x) of this inducement within the parent schedule. This value is relevant for addressing predecessors as fixpoint for the offest-calculation. Within one schedule there can only be one inducement for each position! The 0 is reserved for addressing the parent schedule itself and must not be used as well as negative values!

Fields.Name: SchedulingOffsetFixpoint
Fields.Summary:
0=InducementOfScheduleOrCycle: when the start of the parent Schedule (for the current cycle) was induced / -1=InducementOfPredessessor: when the direct predecessor procedure or subschedule (based on the 'Position') within the current schedule was induced / 1..x: when the predecessor at the Position within the current schedule, ADRESSED by the given value, was induced 
*items of sub-schedules are not relevant - when addressing a sub-schedule as predecessor, then only its entry will be used
*this behaviour can be concretized via 'SchedulingByEstimate'

Fields.Name: SchedulingByEstimate
Fields.Summary: If set to true, the offset calculation will be based on the ESTIMATED completion of the predecessor (see 'Fixpoint'). Otherwise, when set to false, the offset calculation will be based on the REAL completion (if recorded execution data is available during calculation) of the predecessor. *this will not evaluated, when the 'Fixpoint' is set to 0!

Fields.Name: DedicatedToSubstudy
Fields.Summary: The name of a Sub-Study for which this procedure should be induced or empty when its part of the current Arms regular workflow

Fields.Name: VisitNumber
Fields.Summary: Number, which can be used via Placeholder {#} within the UniqueExecutionName and which will automatically increase when using cycles or sub-schedules

Fields.Name: ProdecureDefinitionName
Fields.Summary: Name of the Definition - INVARIANT! because it is used to generate Identifers for induced executions!

Fields.Name: RootTaskScheduleId
Fields.Summary: the TaskSchedule which is representing the primary-/entry-workflow (estimated tasks) when executing this visit

Fields.Name: SchedulingOffset
Fields.Summary: estimated scheduling date relative to the scheduling date of the parent ProcedureSchedule

Fields.Name: SchedulingOffsetUnit
Fields.Summary: 'M'=Months / 'W'=Weeks / 'D'=Days

Fields.Summary:
0=InducementOfScheduleOrCycle: when the start of the parent Schedule (for the current cycle) was induced / -1=InducementOfPredessessor: when the direct predecessor task or subschedule (based on the 'Position') within the current schedule was induced / 1..x: when the predecessor at the Position within the current schedule, ADRESSED by the given value, was induced

Fields.Name: DedicatedToSubstudy
Fields.Summary: The name of a Sub-Study for which this Task should be induced or empty when its part of the current Arms regular workflow

Fields.Name: TaskNumber
Fields.Summary: Number, which can be used via Placeholder {#} within the UniqueExecutionName and which will automatically increase when using cycles or sub-schedules

Fields.Name: TaskDefinitionName
Fields.Summary: Name of the Definition - INVARIANT! because it is used to generate Identifers for induced executions!

Fields.Name: ReschedulingOffsetFixpoint
Fields.Summary:
0=InducementOfScheduleOrCycle: when the start of the last cycle was induced / -1=InducementOfPredessessor: when the last procedure or subschedule (based on the 'Position') of the previous cycle was induced.
*items of sub-schedules are not relevant - when addressing a sub-schedule as predecessor, then only its entry will be used
*this behaviour can be concretized via 'ReschedulingByEstimate'

Fields.Name: ReschedulingOffset
Fields.Summary: estimated scheduling date relative to the ReschedulingBase

Fields.Name: ReschedulingOffsetUnit
Fields.Summary: 'M'=Months / 'W'=Weeks / 'D'=Days

Fields.Name: CycleLimit
Fields.Summary: number of cycles (of null for a infinite number of cycles)

Fields.Name: ReschedulingByEstimate
Fields.Summary: If set to true, the offset calculation will be based on the ESTIMATED completion of the predecessor (see 'Fixpoint'). Otherwise, when set to false, the offset calculation will be based on the REAL completion (if recorded execution data is available during calculation) of the predecessor. *this will not evaluated, when the 'Fixpoint' is set to 0!

Fields.Name: IncreaseVisitNumberBasePerCycle
Fields.Summary: -1: automatic, based on the usage of visit numbers within the schedule

Fields.Name: ReschedulingOffsetFixpoint
Fields.Summary:
0=InducementOfScheduleOrCycle: when the start of the last cycle was induced / -1=InducementOfPredessessor: when the last task or subschedule (based on the 'Position') of the previous cycle was induced.
*items of sub-schedules are not relevant - when addressing a sub-schedule as predecessor, then only its entry will be used
*this behaviour can be concretized via 'ReschedulingByEstimate'

Fields.Name: ReschedulingOffset
Fields.Summary: estimated scheduling time relative to the ReschedulingBase

Fields.Name: ReschedulingOffsetUnit
Fields.Summary: 'h'=Hours / 'm'=Minutes / 's'=Seconds

Fields.Name: CycleLimit
Fields.Summary: number of cycles (of null for a infinite number of cycles)

Fields.Name: ReschedulingByEstimate
Fields.Summary: If set to true, the offset calculation will be based on the ESTIMATED completion of the predecessor (see 'Fixpoint'). Otherwise, when set to false, the offset calculation will be based on the REAL completion (if recorded execution data is available during calculation) of the predecessor. *this will not evaluated, when the 'Fixpoint' is set to 0!

Fields.Name: IncreaseTaskNumberBasePerCycle
Fields.Summary: -1: automatic, based on the usage of task numbers within the schedule

Relations.Name: ProcedureScheduleArm
Relations.ForeignNavigationSummary: the ProcedureSchedule which is representing the primary-/entry-workflow (estimated visits) for participants of this arm

Relations.Name: TaskScheduleVisitProdecureDefinition
Relations.ForeignNavigationSummary: the TaskSchedule which is representing the primary-/entry-workflow (estimated tasks) when executing this visit
